meanings.definition: A variety of a cultivated thistle with edible fleshy leaves and a heart that is usually cooked by boiling or steaming.
meanings.sent1: I cooked some artichokes for dinner last night.
meanings.sent2: Artichokes are delicious when steamed and served with butter.
meanings.sent3: Why did the artichoke go to the party? It heard things were going to get steamed!
meanings.sent4: Her heart was like an artichoke, guarded by layers of fleshy leaves.
meanings.sent5: The artichoke's fleshy leaves protect its tender heart, just like armor shields a knight.

meanings.definition: The immature flower head of a thistle, used as a vegetable.
meanings.sent1: The market had fresh artichokes on sale this morning.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy eating artichokes with a dip made of mayonnaise and lemon.
meanings.sent3: Why did the artichoke refuse to play cards? It was tired of being the heart of the deal!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a garden of ideas, each one a budding artichoke waiting to bloom.
meanings.sent5: The artichoke's purple petals unfurled like a secret waiting to be discovered.
